name: Halloumi, Chickpea, and Tomato Salad with Mint
author: cheesemite
summary: Halloumi is the hot new cheese! Well, really, it's ancient, not new--but it is best fried or grilled, so "hot" is fair, isn't it? This fresh salad combines halloumi with tomatoes, mint, and chickpeas, Mediterranean-style.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Stir chickpeas, tomatoes, green onions, mint, lemon juice, and olive oil in a salad bowl
Season with salt and pepper; set aside
Heat a dry nonstick skillet over medium-high heat
Add halloumi to the hot pan and cook, turning once, until deeply browned, 1 to 2 minutes per side
Remove to a cutting board and chop into 1/2-inch chunks
Stir halloumi into the salad and serve immediately
